strong: (NOTE: Please no LinkedIn invitations or InMail requests - all applicants must apply. No guarantees of "Temp to Perm" or "Contract to Perm" are promised nor implied).

text: a SaaS-based Talent ID startup working in the areas of performing arts & sports, based in NYC.

strong: We're looking for a short-term contract help in the form of a part-time Sports Data Research Analyst.
text: This individual will have a quantitative mindset, be passionate about sports data, and have experience with Fantasy Sports, player tables, linked data, and database management.

p.7: Working with our lead Data Architect, product owners, and scrum master, you'll assist researching, documenting, sourcing, and ingesting key master data in the fields of global professional and amateur sports.
p.9: You'll assist in designing, developing & maintaining all parts of our sports talent data pipeline from multiple public and private data sources =E2=80=93 (structured and unstructured) to collaborate on the development of a datastore of interactive and curated data & metadata (including cleansing, organizing, and normalizing) for driving insights and analytics. Responsibilities include:

li.1: Collaborate on large, complex data sets that meet business requirements
li.2: Interface with the infrastructure required for extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS technologies
li.3: Work with internal and external stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support data infrastructure needs
li.4: Help strategize and establish which metrics and analytics will drive the HAND business needs forward

li: 1+ Year experience in ETL & ELT and implementing data pipelines. This includes on the job, school, or internship experience previously completed.
li.1: Experience with (and/or willing to upskill on) cloud data platforms (AWS)
li.2: Experience in writing and optimizing SQL queries (SPARQL query experience if possible)

li: Terrific research / "data detective" skills (MLIS degree nice to have)
li.1: Self-starter - able to take direction and run with it
li.2: Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
li.3: Able to build strong interpersonal relationships with peers, product owners, and other management throughout the company
li.4: Comfortable with Agile / Scrum development methodologies
li.5: Working knowledge of Asana, Jira and Confluence is desired

p.16: If selected as a candidate, you must be willing to promptly sign a Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement (MNDA). No in-depth interview round will happen without it. Failure to do so, or delays when asked to sign - will result in immediate disqualification.
p.18: PLEASE NOTE: We are not looking for development agencies, coding shops, or data consultancies in our early-stage startup effort, but for highly-capable team members.
p.21: Founded in 2021 and backed by a team of veteran experts in the fields of identity metadata management, knowledge graphs, and new technologies in the media & entertainment business - from major film studios, TV networks, music labels, CGI developers, academia, and commercial R&D labs - HAND has been developed through research, direct user interviews/stories, and industry roundtables - and is uniquely positioned to deliver a solution that will foster and accelerate greater trust in M&E identity. We coordinate with international standards partners, and have handshake agreements with major companies in our space to adopt our technology in their production workflows. Currently in a limited, invitation-only Beta, for more information, please see https://www.handidentity.com
